column8: SWI diffusive mixing, bioturbation (Meire et al. 2013)
Set slightly larger than the depth of bioirrigation

reactivity of labile OM input to the sediment surface. Maximum is about 50 for pure phytoplankton (Eldridge 1998), Chen et al (2005) indicate that chla degradation rate is about 7.5 based on profile data.
if you want something other than a linear decrease in biodiffusion change this (see book by Boudreau 1997)
creation of DOM from POM by cell leakage, lysis, etc.
equilibrium constant (do not change unless you have specific information about Fe minerology)
approximate rates (change within the range of what's in Boudreau 1996)
not labile (NL)OM Ratio normalized to Redfield
not labile (NL)OM Ratio normalized to Redfield
not labile (NL)OM Ratio normalized to Redfield
a0=2+0.5*[O2] (Morse and Eldridge 2006 and Eldridge and Morse 2008)
porosity at sediment surface.  Porosity profile measurements may also be input to the model
change in porosity per depth (see Boudreau 1997)
Number of horizons that are being simulated (1500 is the max, 100-400 is the typical situation).
Model is run to this depth
length of run is hardwired in the FORTRAN code to 100 years in original SDM code.
DOM input concentration (DOMI) input by tube feeders. This allows the model to take DOM from higher above the SWI due to tube feeders.
labile OM flux to sediment surface
non-labile OM flux to sediment surface
if set to 1 this option is turned off. Suggest referencing values rom Morse and Morin (2000)
